news.title: News
news.subtitle: Stay updated with the most important news, events, concerts, and happenings shaping the world of Serbian music and compositional art.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.subtitle: Recommended minimum order value for serious music
recommendations.description: The attached table on the minimum value of orders for serious music stands as an official recommendation of the Association of Composers of Serbia and provides a valid compass on the value of each order, as well as the amount of knowledge, experience, effort, work and time invested in the creation of each composition. The table shows the minimum applicable fee, while the complexity of the work, the expertise and reputation of the composer, the urgency required or the special requirements of the order may result in a higher fee. The values are presented as percentages in relation to the minimum wage in the Republic of Serbia, so it is understood that it is important to update each time you use them. The ethical obligation of all actors in the order is to openly present in advance all the listed, additional and accompanying costs, which are conditioned by the creation of a sound work of art, before agreeing on any kind of cooperation.

members.sectionDescription: The section for association members provides insight into the profiles of our composers, their biographies, works, and contributions to the Serbian music scene, highlighting the importance of their creativity and role in preserving our musical tradition.

slider.supportTitle: Support for the Compositional Art of Serbia
slider.supportDescription: We are dedicated to preserving, promoting, and developing the compositional art in Serbia, providing support to our creators and safeguarding musical traditions.

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: Association of Composers of Serbia
about.description1: The Association of Composers of Serbia represents a prominent and productive organization that, since its founding in 1945, has been dedicated to fostering and preserving Serbian cultural heritage and promoting contemporary musical creativity, both in the realm of classical music and popular genres.
about.members: The Association of Composers of Serbia has 330 members divided into three sections: Composers of Classical Music, Composers of Jazz and Popular Music, and Music Writers (musicologists and ethnomusicologists). The Association of Composers of Serbia invests significant effort to make Serbian music:
about.visibleDesc: by promoting the works of its members, organizing musical events that highlight and perform the music of its distinguished members...
about.presentDesc: by ensuring the works of its composer members are included in the repertoires of symphony orchestras...
about.conclusion: so that their music lives on concert stages, is recorded and broadcast on radio and television, and inspires reviews in professional journals, newspapers, and on music-dedicated portals...
about.coordinator: The UKS representative in the Coordination Board of Artistic Associations is Dragomir Milenković.

aboutAssociation.title: About the Association
aboutAssociation.subtitle: Preserving tradition and inspiring the future of Serbian music
aboutAssociation.description: The Serbian Composers' Association is dedicated to promoting, preserving, and advancing the art of composition, supporting our creators, and nurturing the richness of musical tradition.
